# Introducing the Digital Sovereignty Specialization for the Microsoft AI Cloud Partner Program

[Home](https://www.thomasmaurer.ch/)[Microsoft](https://www.thomasmaurer.ch/category/microsoft/), [Microsoft Azure](https://www.thomasmaurer.ch/category/microsoft/microsoft-azure/)Introducing the Digital Sovereignty Specialization for the Microsoft AI Cloud Partner Program

[Email](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#)

Last week, Microsoft announced the **Digital Sovereignty Specialization** for the **Microsoft AI Cloud Partner Program** ‚Äî a new opportunity designed to help partners demonstrate deep expertise in delivering **sovereign, compliant, and trusted cloud solutions** built on the Microsoft Cloud.

To dive deeper into what this means for partners and customers, [I sat down](https://www.thomasmaurer.ch/2025/10/my-new-role-as-emea-global-black-belt-gbb-for-sovereign-cloud-at-microsoft/) with **Chris Boar**, Senior Director for Cloud and AI Platform Partner GTM and Strategy at Microsoft, to discuss how this new specialization connects with the **[Microsoft Sovereign Cloud](https://www.thomasmaurer.ch/2025/10/how-microsoft-is-addressing-digital-sovereignty-in-switzerland/)** offering ‚Äî including both the **Microsoft Sovereign Public Cloud** and **Microsoft Sovereign Private Cloud**.

üé• **Watch the full conversation below:**

### What is the Digital Sovereignty Specialization?

The **Digital Sovereignty Specialization** enables partners to validate their capabilities in helping customers meet national and regional requirements for **data residency, sovereignty, and compliance** ‚Äî all while leveraging the innovation, scalability, and security of the Microsoft Cloud.

This specialization builds on the foundation of the **Microsoft AI Cloud Partner Program**, providing a clear path for partners who want to differentiate themselves in regulated industries and markets where sovereignty is a top priority.

### How It Aligns with Microsoft Sovereign Cloud

Microsoft‚Äôs Sovereign Cloud strategy is designed to give governments, public sector organizations, and regulated industries the flexibility they need to control their data and digital operations ‚Äî whether through **Sovereign Public Cloud** regions or through **Sovereign Private Cloud** deployments.

The new specialization helps partners align with this strategy by ensuring they have the **technical, operational, and compliance** capabilities required to deliver sovereign cloud solutions in line with Microsoft‚Äôs standards and best practices.

### How to Attain the Digital Sovereignty Specialization

Partners interested in earning the Digital Sovereignty Specialization can follow a structured process that includes meeting **audit and competency requirements**, demonstrating **customer success stories**, and aligning with the **Microsoft Cloud Partner Program** designations.

To get started, we‚Äôve prepared a set of resources that guide partners through each step of the process:

- üìò **Partner Deck:** [https://aka.ms/DigitalSovereigntySpecialization](https://aka.ms/DigitalSovereigntySpecialization)
- ‚ùì **Partner FAQ:** [https://aka.ms/DigitalSovereigntySpecFAQ](https://aka.ms/DigitalSovereigntySpecFAQ)
- üßæ **Audit Checklist:** [https://aka.ms/digitalsovereigntyauditchecklist](https://aka.ms/digitalsovereigntyauditchecklist)

### Benefits for Partners and Customers

By achieving the Digital Sovereignty Specialization, partners can:

- Demonstrate verified expertise in **digital sovereignty and compliance**
- Strengthen trust with customers in **regulated and public sector markets**
- Unlock new opportunities within the **Microsoft Sovereign Cloud ecosystem**
- Showcase their commitment to **secure, compliant, and transparent** cloud services

For customers, this means having trusted partners who can help them meet data sovereignty requirements without compromising innovation or scalability.

### Empowering Trust in the AI Era

As organizations embrace AI and cloud technologies, ensuring **trust, control, and transparency** over data is more important than ever. The Digital Sovereignty Specialization provides a pathway for partners to lead in this space ‚Äî helping customers adopt AI responsibly and securely across sovereign environments.

To learn more, explore the resources linked above and watch the video conversation with **Chris Boar** to get practical insights on how this specialization fits into the future of the Microsoft Cloud.

### About the Author / [Thomas Maurer](https://www.thomasmaurer.ch/author/d9pe/)

![](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%2080%2080'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

Thomas is the EMEA Global Black Belt (GBB) for Sovereign Cloud at Microsoft, helping organizations across the region harness Microsoft‚Äôs sovereign, hybrid, multicloud, and edge solutions. He works directly with C-level leaders and technical teams to remove roadblocks, accelerate digital transformation, and shape long-term cloud strategies that meet business and regulatory needs. With over 15 years of experience in cloud and datacenter, including his previous role as Principal Program Manager and Chief Evangelist for Azure Hybrid, he combines deep technical expertise with a passion for customer success. He specializes in creating scalable architectures, solution accelerators, and thought leadership that drive adoption and innovation on Azure. Thomas is a passionate community advocate and frequently speaks at industry events such as Microsoft Ignite and Microsoft TechDays. He shares his expertise through his Cloud and Datacenter Blog at www.thomasmaurer.ch and on LinkedIn and X.com www.twitter.com/thomasmaurer.
